conclusion: Analyze the image to understand positions of steel balls on inclined plane.
Use given distances to determine time for balls to reach respective positions.
Calculate time for balls to reach position of ball A.
Image shows several identical small steel balls on inclined plane labeled A, B, C with distances AB and BC marked as 15 cm and 20 cm.
Steel balls released every 0.1 seconds without initial velocity.
Time interval between each ball's release is 0.1 seconds.
Distances AB and BC are given as 15 cm and 20 cm.
Calculate total distance covered by balls B and C: AB + BC = 35 cm.
Determine number of 0.1-second intervals needed to cover 35 cm: 350 intervals.
Calculate time for balls to reach position of ball A: 35 seconds.
